content.description:
Another good line that would be either a mild solo or pitched out. Top pitch provides a bit of adventure. 

This is the third climb from the right going left in the Cozy Warm area. 
A few screws for pro and belays.

Fun line going right up the middle of the fan. 

This is the middle route in the group of 3 lines of the Cozy Warm area. 
A few screws.

Pitch 1 - Scramble up low angle rock, ice or snow to a cave, get and get an anchor with either rock or ice pro. We used a couple of pins. 
Pitch 2 - From the cave traverse out left on decent rock then up to access a narrow runnel of ice. Climb ice for about 50 meters to a recess and belay off good screws. We used one pin for pro on the rock section.
Pitch 3 - Continue up the runnel to the top. 
Awesome route with better rock than usual for the area. Climbing in the runnel is super fun.

Found about 200 meters west of Cozy Warm.
A rack of screws and a small selection of pitons.

Easy solo either up or down. Great way to warm up or get to the bottom without taking your rope out of your pack.

This will be the first route you will see in the Cozy, Warm area. Long, low angle flow that disappears into the trees about 3/4 of the way up.
Your tools and good feet.

climbs.name: The Wim Hof Method
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes, Mike Delaney and Craig Norris

content.description:
If the last 20 meters of this climb were on either good rock or ice this would be a 4 star route. As it is now I wouldn't even recommend that the last pitch be repeated. The best course of action is to rap off after the first 3 pitches which are very high quality.
Pitch 1 - A steep, broad curtain of ice leads to a lower angled ramp. Follow this to the next steeper part on the left.  About 50 meters. WI4+
Pitch 2 - Climb the 70 degree column of ice to a loose section of rock. Move left to find screws for a belay. 45 meters. WI3 
Pitch 3 - Depending on where you belayed move to regain the line heading up to a good sections of ice interspersed with decent quality rock. Follow thin ice and rock to a short vertical to overhanging section of ice. There will be an opportunity for some screws but not many. Climb the steep part then follow a good ice ramp to a solid screw anchor belay. 45 meter WI4+ M5
Pitch 4 - This pitch starts out with a wonderful steep section of ice but then changes to a chossy 20 meters of rock to the tree anchor and top out. 35 meters. WI3+ M5 R.

This route is found about 500 meters east of Shore Thing.  If you are travelling west from The Chains area this will be the second small cove containing several ice routes. A 25 meter, steep, obvious broad curtain of ice will be very visible from the beach. This is the start.
A rack of screws, maybe a couple of pins and light rock rack.

This is the last area of climbing before Refugee Cove. The approach to here would be between 90 minutes and 2 hours. There are three very easy lines close together that provide nice mellow climbs either for soloing or anyone who wants to get a feel for the place before jumping on some of the harder stuff. This area is also very easy to descend from the top if you downclimb through tuckamore just east of the first route (Shore Thing). You could also downclimb any line quite easily.
